Class Enemy

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.Entity
model.Enemy
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MovingRobot, StandingRobot
public abstract class Enemy extends Entity
An abstract base class for all enemy entities in the game. It defines common properties such as type, state, direction, and behavior, and declares abstract methods that specific enemy implementations must provide.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Enemy

      public Enemy(int x, int y, int width, int height, EnemyType type)
      Constructs a new Enemy.
      Parameters:
      x - The initial x-coordinate.
      y - The initial y-coordinate.
      width - The width of the enemy.
      height - The height of the enemy.
      type - The EnemyType of this enemy.

  • Method Details

    • update

      public abstract void update(long currentTime, Level levelData, Player player)
      Updates the enemy's state and logic. This method is called on every game tick.
      Parameters:
      currentTime - The current system time in milliseconds.
      levelData - The data for the current level.
      player - The player object, for interaction checks.

    • move

      public abstract void move()
      Executes the enemy's movement logic.

    • turn

      protected abstract void turn()
      Makes the enemy turn around to face the opposite direction.

    • resetPosition

      public abstract void resetPosition()
      Resets the enemy to its initial position and state.

    • setState

      protected abstract void setState(EnemyState state)
      Sets the enemy's current state.
      Parameters:
      state - The new EnemyState.

    • getAttackBox

      public abstract Rectangle2D.Float getAttackBox()
      Returns:
      The hitbox used for attack collisions.

    • getDurationForState

      public abstract long getDurationForState(EnemyState state)
      Parameters:
      state - The state for which to get the duration.
      Returns:
      The duration in milliseconds for the given state.

    • getStateStartTime

      public abstract long getStateStartTime()
      Returns:
      The timestamp when the current state was entered.
